intro: Tephroseris integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Tephroseris integrifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
